pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
:lock: Permission denied

Existing reviewers: [click here to make pechersky a reviewer](https://mathlib-bors-ca18eefec4cb.herokuapp.com/repositories/16/add-reviewer/pechersky)
Let's get it merge by retriggering CI with added label.

As this PR is labelled `auto-merge-after-CI`, we are now sending it to bors:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded!

*And happy new year! 🎉*


  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7372876970/job/20061589899)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7372876970/job/20061589925)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7372876970/job/20061589871)

Linter not happy with these now; what happened during the two weeks?
```
/- The `simpNF` linter reports:
SOME SIMP LEMMAS ARE NOT IN SIMP-NORMAL FORM.
see note [simp-normal form] for tips how to debug this.
https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib_docs/notes.html#simp-normal%[20](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7335822631/job/19974251086#step:20:21)form -/
-- Mathlib.Data.Fin.Basic
Error: ./././Mathlib/Data/Fin/Basic.lean:1362:1: error: Fin.neg_nat_cast_eq_one simp can prove this:
  by simp only [Fin.cast_nat_eq_last, Fin.neg_last]
One of the lemmas above could be a duplicate.
If that's not the case try reordering lemmas or adding @[priority].

Error: ./././Mathlib/Data/Fin/Basic.lean:1370:1: error: Fin.nat_cast_add_one_eq_zero simp can prove this:
  by simp only [Fin.cast_nat_eq_last, Fin.last_add_one]
One of the lemmas above could be a duplicate.
If that's not the case try reordering lemmas or adding @[priority].
```
Yury modified `cast_nat_eq_last` and made it a simp lemma.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Fin CharP and lemmas for Fin rollover
